title: 114_s2078
content:
The Act titled "United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reauthorization Act of 2015" extends the authority of the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom until September 30, 2019. The Act emphasizes the Commission's role in assessing threats to religious freedom globally and ensuring that U.S. efforts to promote religious freedom abroad are effective. SEC. 4. STRATEGIC PLAN.
    Definitions:
        - Appropriate congressional committees: Senate Committee on Foreign Relations, House Committee on Foreign Affairs, Senate Committee on Appropriations, House Committee on Appropriations.
        - Commission: United States Commission on International Religious Freedom.
        - Commissioner: Member of the Commission.
        - Vice chair: Vice Chair of the Commission appointed to the position by an elected official. The Chair and Vice Chair of the Commission, along with Commissioners and other selected individuals, will conduct a strategic policy and organizational review planning process as outlined in the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998. The Commission is required to prioritize actions, review annual reports, and personnel policies under the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998. The Chair, Vice Chair, and Commissioners aim for unanimous agreement on strategic planning processes. The Commission must prioritize actions and review policies under the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998. The Chair and Vice Chair aim for unanimous agreement on the strategic plan, but if not possible, approval can be done by a majority vote of Commissioners from different political parties. The strategic plan must be submitted to congressional committees every 180 days. The strategic plan for the Commission includes prioritized actions, changes to the annual report, personnel matters, and funding requirements. It may also address unresolved issues and allow for the implementation of personnel provisions. The Commission is authorized to implement personnel provisions and the annual report as part of the strategic plan. Congressional oversight allows for inspection of information and documents, as well as testimony before appropriate committees. Authorization of appropriations for the Commission is set at $3,500,000 for fiscal years 2016 to 2019. The Commission on International Religious Freedom Reauthorization Act of 2015 authorizes funds to remain available until expended or until the Commission is terminated. The Commission can only spend appropriated amounts if it complies with specified requirements and submits an annual financial report to congressional committees.
